name: Airfoil CFD Surrogate Modeling
description: Predict steady-state 2D velocity and pressure fields around airfoils in subsonic, incompressible flow regimes, along with derived quantities such as lift and drag coefficients.

cr:input.name: competition_dataset
cr:input.description: Dataset derived from CFD simulations using OpenFOAM, validated against NASA TMR experimental data. Includes airfoil geometry in unstructured mesh format, boundary conditions (e.g., Angle of Attack), and point cloud data with features such as positions, inlet_velocity, distance_to_airfoil, and normals.

cr:output.name: predictions
cr:output.description: Predictions for velocity components (ux, uy), pressure fields (ps), turbulent viscosity (νt), and derived quantities (drag coefficient CD, lift coefficient CL, density-related metrics ρD, ρL). Outputs must adhere to physical laws and align with expected CFD behavior.

field.name: ps
field.description: Predicted pressure divided by specific mass (numerical)

cr:evaluation.notes: Global score is a weighted combination of ML-related metrics, OOD generalization, and physics compliance. Speed-up is normalized using log10 scaling.

open_questions: Exact memory limits are not specified in the paper.
Details on acceptable ranges for derived quantities (e.g., thresholds T1, T2) are missing.
fill_in_the_blank: cr:input[0].url - dataset URL not specified in paper
